intro: Phlegmariurus heterocarpos, commonly known as the broad-leaved clubmoss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Huperjiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and elongated, broad leaves that are often arranged in two rows. The plant produces small, clustered sporangia at the tips of its branches, which release spores for reproduction. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. This species plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
